thread.title: Pickup truck nearly rolls down embankment north of Peachland - Okanagan | Globalnews.ca

author: Lauren Pullen
title: Pickup truck nearly rolls down embankment north of Peachland - Okanagan | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 3, 2017 1:05 pm Updated: February 3, 2017 9:03 pm Pickup truck nearly rolls down embankment north of Peachland By Lauren Pullen Anchor/Reporter Global News What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
A crash on Highway 97 north of Peachland, in the area of Drought Hill, closed Highway 97 in both directions Friday morning. 
“The roads today are very, very slippery with packed snow and black ice everywhere,” said RCMP Cst. John Doane. 
A pickup truck nearly rolled down an embankment just after 9 a.m. 
Luckily, the back end of the truck got tangled up on the concrete barrier which stopped the vehicle from a roughly 50 metre plunge down the steep hillside. 

Blaine Gaffney / Global News 
Blaine Gaffney / Global News 
The highway was closed for about 15 minutes while the pickup was removed from its perch by a tow truck. 
The driver wasn’t injured. He says he lost control of his vehicle because of the snow covered road. 
RCMP are asking drivers to slow down when road conditions are snowy. 
“The posted speed limit is for ideal driving conditions only,” said Doane. 

. @KelownaRCMP say slow down and drive safe. Roads may be slippery due to the weather conditions #Kelowna #WestKelowna #LakeCountry pic.twitter.com/H3GdGUhJAl 
— Kelowna RCMP (@KelownaRCMP) February 3, 2017 © 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
